conditions.today: 6 AM—Pop out of bed; you don't need extra beauty sleep. And besides, it's time to reap the large rewards from a tiny little touch-up, two inches deep. Freshly softened corduroy carpeting will guide you through a nicely refurbished alpine landscape. Continue your smooth cruise or dip off-piste into the mad world of micro-powder pockets. Dramatic skies will feature bright solar beams breaking through a perforated cloud cover. Comfortable high temperatures will top out near 20 at the summit while Teton Village makes its way toward the 30-degree mark. A refreshing west-northwest breeze will blow in the 5 to 15 mph neighborhood. When it comes to societal productivity, skiing probably isn't the best activity. But it's by far the greatest way to escape from toxic cultural captivity. -Lege
conditions.yesterday: 6 AM—Pssst. Hey. Wakey, wakey! We've got a welcome little change in the air for your Wednesday. Early morning sunshine will yield to encroaching cloud cover before midday, so come quick and you may catch a couple rays. But, even if you miss 'em, stick around. Because before too long, some cool frosty flakes should be coming down. High temperatures will top out near 20 at the summit and in the upper 20s down in the Village. Winds should remain on the light side, breezing out of the west in the 5-15 mph range. Head for the slopes without fear or hesitation. Because the time has come to get a little zesty with the forces of gravitation, as a sacrificial offering to the atmosphere for an extra hefty powder application. - Lege

morningBrief.headline: Fresh Layer in Place
morningBrief.body: The mountain got a nice 2" touch-up. Expect improved conditions. 4 new trails opened today.
